work.name: Amazon India
work.summary: Spearheaded migration of Supply Chain Inbound Forecasting from manual to an algorithm-based forecasting model. Drafted new ways of working for all stakeholders and led pilot launch. Performed extensive data analysis, identified downstream challenges, led solution-focused project meetings and obtained leadership approvals, improving overall forecasting accuracy by 10%.
highlights: Program Management, Data Analysis, Team Leadership

work.name: Continuum Robotics Laboratory, University of Toronto
work.summary: Fabricated a portable Tendon Driven Continuum Robot (TDCR), as part of the OpenCR Project. Created custom BLDC actuators and optimised tendon routes using Fusion 360 and TI Launchpad. Built a fully-actuated segment TDCR-based manual endoscope using tension-based and mechanical logic elements to create reliable control by eliminating digital latency.

work.name: Mars Rover Manipal
work.summary: Directed all technical operations of a team of 40 engineering undergraduates from 5 disciplines, involved in over 10 research & development projects and 7 international competitions. Engineered a Mars Rover Prototype for extra-terrestrial exploration comprising an on-board 6-DOF Robotic Manipulator with Inverse Kinematic Control, Custom 40:1 Cycloidal 3D-Printed Gearbox, and a novel 5-bar Suspension System to compete in University Rover Challenge (Ranked 1st in Asia).
